screen_desc: This is an Amazon search results page for "MacBook Air." The user is able to filter results by RAM size (8GB, 6GB, 4GB). The first result is a 2020 Apple MacBook Air with an M1 chip priced at $967.50, showing a limited stock warning. Other results include a 2017 model and a late-2018 model with different specifications and prices.
action_think: The user requested to view and add the 'MacBook Air' to the shopping cart. The user has already navigated to the Amazon page for 'MacBook Air' and has viewed a specific result. The next logical step is to add the 'MacBook Air' product to the cart, as the shopping cart icon has been interacted with several times but not yet finalized. I will proceed with adding the item to the cart from the current screen.
action_plan: Select the '2020 Apple MacBook Air Laptop: Apple M1 Chip' from the search results.
Add the selected 'MacBook Air' item to the shopping cart.
action_desc: Click on the '2020 Apple MacBook Air Laptop' result to go to its product page.
action_result:
By clicking on the product image of the second MacBook Air search result, the page has now loaded the detailed product view. This includes information such as the price ($390.00), product condition (refurbished), and delivery details. 

This action moves us closer to fulfilling the user request, as it enables us to add the selected product to the shopping cart. However, we need to press the "Add to Cart" button, which is still required to complete the task of adding the MacBook Air to the cart on Amazon.
prev_action_result:
By pressing the back button, you have navigated away from the product page where you were selecting a MacBook Air. This action has caused you to return to the search results page, where multiple MacBook Air listings are now visible.

This action has made progress towards the user request in the sense that it returned you to the previous step, but it has not yet added the MacBook Air to the shopping cart. To complete your request, you would need to select a MacBook Air from the search results and then click on the "Add to Cart" button to add it to the shopping cart.
